question: Which are the member-countries of the "Visegrad Group"?
option3: Poland, Czech Republic, Hungary and Slovakia
answer: Poland, Czech Republic, Hungary and Slovakia
explanation: Poland, Czech Republic, Hungary and Slovakia are the member countries of Visegrad Group. This group is also known as Visegrad Four or V4. It was established in 1991 to advance military, cultural, economic and energy cooperation with one another and also to further the integration of member countries with the European Union.
